entry.title: Use Employment Differentiator for Translation Limitation on People Profile and Spotlight Header
entry.content:
From customer implementation, we observe that the language translation on the spotlight header would stay in default language English instead of the expected translation version (f.e. French) by Language switch via user Settings.  Know issue was reported by the SAP Note below.

2648773 - Position Title and Department and Division are shown in English on Employee Profile header - Employee Profile

First, the French Translation has maintained in the Globe context menu for the Position. From the screenshots below, after switch the user language to French,  the translation for these Job and Org fields are displayed properly in Full Spotlight "Organization" Category Card.  However, the same French translation could not be synced to the Spotlight Header or Full Profile Header part where they are still displayed in English.

Secondarily, these Organization and Job Information fields displayed on Spotlight and Header Areas are coded with no feasibility to customize. 

 ‚ÄÉ

‚ÄÉ

As a workaround, we could introduce to use Employment Differentiator.  This differentiators function provides flexibility to display defined or customized three fields from JobInfo for all users no matter whether the user has multiple employments or not. You don't need to have prerequisite like multiple employments, concurrent employments, global assignment etc. This could be considered as "An Addition" for Customization. 

In my practice below to display French version of Division, Department and Job Classification in Spotlight and Full Profile Header. In general, we need to create an Employment Differentiator object in Manage Data. An Employment Differentiator allow maximum 3 custom fields by design. We can leverage these 3 custom fields to link to standard or custom fields from Job Information Model HRIS Elements (ONLY). Then, the values (picklist configured for HRIS elements) can be displayed accordingly by this Employment Differentiator. Here comes the key configuration steps: 

Step 1 - Create Picklist for "JobClass_FR", "Division_FR", and "Dept_FR" respectively. Set these 3 picklist values directly as the French version of translation (These can be fetched from Manage Position). 

Step 2 - In Business Configuration, create custom-string for "Division FR", "Dept FR" and "Job Class FR" and set the picklist we configuration in Step 1 to the object respectively. 

Step 3 - Set Permission Roles for the custom-strings created in Step 2 for both System Admin and Employee Self Service. The proper role settings make sure both New Hire and Existing Employee will not miss to select the value defined in picklist as mandatory. 

This is important to remember that If the value used for the differentiator is not available in the current Job Information record, the value will not be displayed in People Profile.

Step 4 - To adopt Employment Differentiator, assignmentDisplayHeader should be enabled in Business Configuration -> Employee Profile -> Standard. 

In addition, please make sure RBP settings are configured for both System Admin and Employee Self Service to View/Edit Employee Data -> Employee Profile -> ASSIGNMENTDISPLAYHEADER.

Step 5 - Set up the Employment Differentiator object to connect the dots. It is named "Org Job FR" in my practice and its 3 custom fields point to the 3 custom-string created in Step 2. Jobinfo is only the supported HRIS element reference by design.

Step 6 - To Switch ON the Employment Differentiator, go to Configuration Latest People Profile -> General Settings -> Choose the Name created in Step 5 from the dropdown list of Choose Employment Differentiator.  Click the Save button.

Do not forget to Refresh Assignment Header and Refresh General Display Name from the Company System and Logo Settings to activate it.  After both HRIS Sync jobs are Completed from Scheduled Job Monitoring, it's time to check the final result. 

Step 7 - Final Check. The French Version can be displayed on header no matter which language setting is selected. 

Last but not least, Employment Differentiator could be used not only for translation workaround, but for dispalying any additional job information as well.

More details could be referred in the following SAP Help link. 

Adding Employment Differentiators To Indicate Multiple Employments

2786331 - Employee Central - Employment Differentiators Indicator

Thanks for your reading and hope this blog is helpful!

Ah condition has always one context/value only but true value and false result has more context depending on source(PARTN_NUMB).

I'm mapping from source(PARTN_NUMB) to target(PARTN_NUMB)
Source(PARTN_NUMB):
1 value1
2 null
3 value3

If field1=1 and field2=Yes, I need to pass this one time fieldID=123 for example (these 3 fields occurs once).

the expected value for target(PARTN_NUMB) should be then:
Target(PARTN_NUMB):
1 123
2 null
3 123

However if did not met above condition, it should proceed with false condition.

@ManoelCosta 

I have gone through the latest updates in Data Fields and noticed a new data type called List. This allows us to create list fields, assign them to a Data Collection, and then select the required field while collecting data. That works well.

However, I would like to know how we can retrieve the Data Fields that are created at a plant level or fetch details for a specific Data Field. For example, there is a service called Retrieve Data Group, where we pass the plant and DC group name, and it returns the response with the DC group name and its parameters list.

But I couldn‚Äôt find a similar service to read Data Fields data (either by plant or by a specific Data Field name) in SAP Business Accelerator Hub or in Design Production Process.

Could you please guide me on how to read the Data Fields data by plant or by a specific Data Field name?
Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Nandiswar

entry.title: Re: calculating depreciatio in SAP SAC Advance formula
entry.content:
Hi @Chanti 

Based on your requirement, I created the Advanced formulas script. Please check and apply it to your model. 

Model: Asset Dimension

  • Useful Life: Decimal Type
  • Start Date: Text Type
  • End Date: Test Type

Depreciation Calculating Script

MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = "Amount"
MEMBERSET [d/Asset] = ("Asset_01", "Asset_02", "Asset_03")
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/Start] TO [d/Version].[p/End]

FLOAT @Useful_Life
FLOAT @Start_Depreciation
FLOAT @End_Depreciation

//To aggregate Total Cost of each asset, Define Variable member and aggregate Cost value of Budget period.
VARIABLEMEMBER #Tatal_Cost OF [d/Account]
DATA([d/Account] = #Tatal_Cost, [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/Start]) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "Cost")

FOREACH [d/Asset]
	//Conversion each attribute value of asset to Numeric value 
	@Useful_Life = ATTRIBUTE([d/Asset].[p/Useful_Life]) * 12
	@Start_Depreciation = YEAR([d/Asset].[p/End_Date]) * 12 + MONTH([d/Asset].[p/End_Date]) + 1
	@End_Depreciation = YEAR([d/Asset].[p/End_Date]) * 12 + MONTH([d/Asset].[p/End_Date]) + 1 + @Useful_Life
	
    //Compare the budget version period with the asset‚Äôs depreciation period, 
	//and record the depreciation expense for the portion of the depreciation period that falls within the budget period.
	IF(YEAR([d/Date]) * 12 + MONTH([d/Date])) >= @Start_Depreciation AND (YEAR([d/Date]) * 12 + MONTH([d/Date])) < @End_Depreciation THEN
		DATA([d/Account] = "Depreciation") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = #Tatal_Cost, [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/Start]) / @Useful_Life
	ENDIF
ENDFOR

 

Example: Source data 

Example: Calculated Result

  • Asset3
    • Total cost =  2400
    • Useful life = 12 Month(1 Year)
    • Depreciation Start Period = 2025.Jul (Asset End date: 2025.Jun)
    • Depreciation End Period = 2026.Jun (12 Months)
    • Depreciation Exp: 200 (2400 / 12)

 

I hope this is helpful to you, and if I have misunderstood anything, please feel free to reach out.

Moonjun

entry.title: Types of ATC Errors in CDS views
entry.content:
While working with core data services (CDS) views in SAP, developers have to ensure performance, quality and stability .  So for this purpose  ATC is a major tool which can help to ensure identifying those potential issues in cds views because of which performance may decline.  So in this blog post am going to share my knowledge regarding these ATC error which can decrease performance of our Application. 

Some of the Types of ATC Error in cds views: 

Empty result Set 

This error indicates that cds views which is built on any table or other views are not able to fetch the data and returning empty dataset i.e. no data in CDS views. This can be happened because of faulty join condition, Association, wrong filters, or base view or table doesn‚Äôt have data which may leads to Empty dataset at Runtime. 

Fix: proper join condition, association condition should be appropriate, correct filter condition. 

Non-Unique Key 

This is one of the common error which may occur because of missing key fields in the cds views or base view have some duplicate data. wrong key combination can also leads to this error or incomplete key definition. 

      ATC is used to Highlights performance bottlenecks such as: 

  • Deeply nested cds views. 
  • Too many of Association which may leads to be expensive join. 
  • Projecting all fields instead of required fields  

Fix:  So in case one have to define all key fields to identify values uniquely. Also sometimes we need to mention additional keys as key fields to resolve this issue. 

Cyclic joins 

A cyclic joins error may cause multiple loop between cds views or entities, which leads to runtime error . 

Fix: So we have to design cds views in such a way it will remove cyclic condition and make it simple data model. 

Runtime KPI Violation 

This ATC error is happened most likely because of memory consumption, response time  

Or load on database. There is a threshold limit for every cds views. If cds views is breaching these threshold value to fech data in that time it will return this kind of error. 

Fix: Need to Analyse plan visualizer file(plv) file, reduce complexity, apply some filters to minimize load on database 

Insufficient Test Data 

In some cases there is less no. of records is present in the cds views which is not matching their expected value which is defined for every cds views. So  one have to check whether there is sufficient no. Of records is present or not in the cds views. 

Fix: Cds views should have minimum expected records available in a test system or need to maintain no. Of records which is less than expected records. 

Conclusion: 

By Fixing these ATC error in cds views, developers can ensure: 

  • Simple data model and accurate output. 
  • Better performance of application at Runtime. 
  • Easier maintainability.

entry.title: Re: PO public cloud - How can we detect delivery errors (...
entry.content:
Hello @AN23 

In the SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the Monitor Email Transmissions app shows only the status of emails sent from SAP even if the recipient's mailbox is invalid or the message bounces. The app status may display Succeeded because it tracks outbound transmission from SAP but not actual delivery to the supplier.

Here are some limitations and points to note

SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud does not provide native delivery or read receipt notifications integrated into its standard output management or monitor app.

The outbound status means the message left the SAP system. However, delivery failures at the recipient side in a situation where the email addresses are invalid are not tracked back into the system. So not delivered email will not be reflected in SAP.

Here are recommendations on how you can workaround that scenario

First thing to consider is to regularly audit and update supplier contact information to minimize invalid addresses.

If your organization requires confirmation of delivery, consider routing outbound emails through a middleware, SAP Integration Suite or a managed email gateway can surely be of help here. These options can process bounces and delivery errors and potentially report those back into SAP or via separate notifications.

Check if your email infrastructure or IT team can set up external monitoring or bounce-tracking for these transmissions but this solution would have to be outside SAP standard capabilities.

Monitor Email Transmissions

The summary is that SAP Public Cloud currently does not map external mailbox non-delivery errors back to Purchase Order or monitor apps. It is important to note that a middleware or external mail monitoring is required to address this challenge.

I hope this provides the desired result. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

The session covers a high level overview of the mission, key components, integrated toolchain for transformation.

entry.title: Transformative Lessons from SAP NOW AI Tour Argentina
entry.content:
On August 28th, SAP brought its renowned SAP NOW AI Tour to Argentina, offering a unique opportunity for local professionals to engage with cutting-edge AI innovations. We had the honor of participating in sessions where more than 1,000 experts shared their innovative ideas, experiences, and case studies. The event featured an extensive catalogue of talks, covering a wide range of topics related to various fields of interest regarding AI, ensuring there was something valuable for everyone. In the following sections, I will share my personal insights and reflections on the talks I attended and the overall event.

Reflecting on the occasion, the word that comes to mind is "transformative" due to the profound impact of the event. On one hand, it was a huge source of inspiration: new ideas, visions, interesting strategies, and personal experiences were shared. On the other hand, it provided practical insights through real cases and projects. This means that all the experts were capable of delivering not only an aspirational message, but also some proof that served as a truthful outcome.

One of the strongest ideas presented during the event was the notion of a virtuous circle created by the integration of applications, data, and artificial intelligence. We were shown how these elements, when working together, can generate outcomes that are more resilient, more sustainable, and more efficient. What struck me the most is that this perspective positioned AI not as something external or distant, but as an element that can and should be embedded into our everyday processes. For a company like ours, this confirmed that the future of AI lies in making it part of the very foundation of the business.

Another highlight was seeing Joule, and the different ways in which it is already being applied. We learned that it has the potential to simplify a great portion of repetitive tasks, allowing teams to dedicate their time and creativity to areas that truly generate value. 

Finally, the reflections on responsible AI gave the sessions a deeper meaning. Beyond the technical demonstrations, there was a constant reminder of the importance of building systems that are transparent and trustworthy. For me, this emphasis on ethics was essential: it reminded us that innovation must go hand in hand with accountability, especially when the goal is to design solutions that people will rely on every day. 

Despite the diversity of experts and talks, a common theme emerged: there is no single correct way to achieve success. The real challenge is to find the method, the technique, the strategy that best works for you. About the topic, experts at the event encouraged us to take advantage of all the tools and resources available to build an efficient ecosystem that adapts to our needs and showcases our uniqueness.

Connected with what was said above, this phrase resonated with me the most: you have to pluck up the courage and just do things. Success is the best teacher for failure. In order to succeed in something, it is necessary to conceive the idea of failing as something inevitable ‚Äì and indispensable ‚Äì and to include it within the planning towards a goal. Otherwise, the frustration will be not only unbearable, but we will forget about how important it is for our progress. Where would we take the valuable lessons from, if not from failing time after time? Consider this: if you are not experiencing failures, it might indicate that you are not challenging yourself or progressing. A lack of failure could mean that you are stuck in the same place.

And what about you? Have you attended the SAP AI Tour yet? When is it coming to your city? Have you learned anything that has impacted the way you view AI? What are your expectations if you are planning to attend this event in the future?

entry.title: Re: WBS elements do not exist in Service Order migration...
entry.content:
Hello @ISoma 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through it.

Please note that currently, the standard migration object for Service Orders in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Migration Cockpit does not offer a dedicated field to assign WBS elements to service orders in bulk during migration. This limitation is confirmed in recent SAP Community and Knowledge Base discussions.

To achieve your migration project, here are some options on how to workaround the limitations

The Migration Cockpit supports extensibility, that means you can add custom fields to the migration template. Some users have stored the WBS element in a custom field and then processed this mapping with a post-migration automation or enhancement.

You should consider performing the migration without WBS element assignment, then running a mass update using standard SAP APIs, custom ABAP reports, or Excel uploads via Fiori apps if available, to assign WBS elements to newly migrated service orders.

Please note, the migration cockpit also provides a separate object for WBS elements. This allows for hierarchical import of WBS structures, not assignment to service orders.

SAP KBA 2981336 confirms WBS element hierarchy import via migration, but not direct service order/WBS linkage

Enterprise Project Data Migration (WBS structure import)

Enterprise project

The summary is, WBS element assignment to service orders via Migration Cockpit is not natively supported in bulk. You need to use custom fields for mapping or update post-migration through standard tools or automation.

I hope this provides the desired insights. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: „É™„Éº„ÇπË≥áÁî£„ÅÆÊò®Âπ¥Â∫¶ÈÅ°ÂèäË®à‰∏ä„Éª„É™„Éº„ÇπÊÉÖÂ†±Â§âÊõ¥„Å´Èñ¢„Åó„Å¶
entry.content: @HelpDesk3  you must first use SAP's retroactive asset accounting functionality. Execute transaction AFAR for the asset, ensuring its capitalization date is set to 01.12.2024; this will automatically calculate and post all missed depreciation from December 2024 through March 2025 into the correct fiscal periods. Then, to handle the contract change effective 01.07.2025, use ABAON to post a write-down for the value reduction (MYR 53.85) and AS02 to adjust the useful life to the new remaining term. Future depreciation runs (AFAB) will then use the new, corrected values automatically

entry.title: Re: PO public cloud - How can we detect delivery errors (...
entry.content:
Hello @AN23 

In the SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, the Purchase Order Output process is deemed successful once the message is handed over from the system to the configured SMTP service, such as SAP Cloud Integration with SAP Output Management. That‚Äôs why, in the Monitor Email Transmissions app, you will only see Succeeded, even if the recipient‚Äôs mailbox later rejects the email, as if the contact has left the supplier.

To identify delivery errors Non-Delivery Receipts, NDRs, you need to review the bounce notifications generated by the external mail server. These are not automatically tracked within S/4HANA Cloud. Follow the steps instead,

  1. Email Relay SMTP Mailbox Monitoring
  • Set up your email relay with Microsoft 365, Google Workspace, or SAP Business Technology Platform mail service to receive and log bounce messages.
  • These NDRs are sent back to the sender's address configured in Output Management.
  1. Central Monitoring
    • If you are using SAP BTP Integration Suite or a mail relay in between, you can create monitoring or alert rules to capture bounce codes and notify IT or Purchasing.
  1. Supplier Master Data Recommendation
    • The best practice is to assign a generic supplier mailbox like orders@supplier.com in the Supplier Master Data instead of an individual contact. This prevents failed deliveries when a contact leaves.

SAP Help Portal: Output Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Output Management (Public Cloud)

SAP KBA ‚Äì 3627419 - How to prevent undeliverable bounce back email messages for participant users in SPM Project when out of officePublic (KBA)

In summary, S/4HANA Cloud alone cannot confirm if the supplier‚Äôs mailbox rejected an email. You need to rely on your email relay‚Äôs bounce handling, and when possible, use generic supplier addresses instead

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Starting My SAP Journey as a Real Estate Specialist (...
entry.content:
Hello @alizare94 

Good to know you are starting you apprentiship and want to chase a Career in SAP. Let me walk you through it.

For a career as an Immobilienkaufmann with SAP, the most critical modules to start with are SAP Flexible Real Estate Management, Financial Accounting and optionally Asset Management. I consider these to be the foundation of real estate processes and integration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud and core ERP platforms.

Below are recommended modules you should consider learning

  • SAP RE-FX: This is central for real estate property and contract management, lease administration, and integration with finance.
  • FI (Financial Accounting): This is essential for managing postings, financial reports, and reconciliation related to real estate assets.
  • Asset Management/EAM: Is useful for managing the lifecycle and maintenance of properties from an operational angle.

Beginner-Friendly Learning Path

Start with a basic introduction to SAP using free online courses such as Alison‚Äôs Introduction to SAP.

Thereafter you can progress to SAP RE-FX, leveraging courses like SAP Flexible RealEstate Management (REFX) Online Training and YouTube videos for real world demonstrations.

Please make sure to explore SAP‚Äôs official Learning Journeys for structured, role-based content:
https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys.

Ensure to supplement with asset management and finance content from beginner assets, which is available on YouTube and tutorials.

Free Courses and Resources

SAP Learning Journeys provide regularly updated and structured certification paths which is available in module.

There are also some openSAP migrated courses which are now free on SAP Learning site and this includes many relevant to RE-FX and asset management.

I also suggest you prioritize hands-on experience through trial systems or sandbox environments, practice navigating SAP Fiori and classic interfaces.

Focus on understanding core business processes such as property lifecycle, contract management and lease accounting.

Ensure you join the SAP Community (https://community.sap.com/topics/group-reporting). This will help you exchange insights, ask questions directly on the platform and stay updated on best practices.

Finally, I suggest you consider networking with professionals in real estate SAP roles for practical career advice and mentorship.

I wish you success in your journey.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: UI5 Application works from BAS, but from HTML5 Repo,...
entry.content:
Finally found the issue.

In Neo environment we have oData provisioning, so selecting that destination it has a alias like example (xyz = /sap/opu)
So in BAS after importing the project, in ui5.yaml under backend config, I see 2 entries 1 for path:"/sap" and other for path:"xyz" along with pathPrefix:"/sap/opu".

Also in the app manifest & other areas where the oDataModel is being instantiated I see the serviceURL as "/xyz/odata/sap/<servicename>.

I refactored all service urls, removed and replaced "xyz" to "/sap/opu".

Undeployed previous version from CF, rebuilt and redeployed.
Finally It started working.

entry.title: Re: Experimenting with AI-Enhanced ABAP Development Setup
entry.content:
Hi @SadiqManji ,

thank you for your comment. I mainly use Github CoPilot at work and achieved the best results so far with Claude Sonnet 4. 
I will try other assistants soon, e.g. claude code & aws kiro in private projects.

I do not have Joule available at work, but did a few things with it at the 2025 DSAG ABAP development days in Wiesloch. 
tbh - I did not like it at all. For me it is too tailored in pre-defined scenarios and I do not like that I need to click on objects in the workspace, go to context menu, choose Joule, choose the action I want to perform. 
For me, the most benefits come from free interaction with the assistant and the assistant should be able to do/ change whatever I advise it to - not just preconfigured actions.

But that might just be my personal preference.

entry.title: Re: Failed to load destination. Caused by: No user token...
entry.content:
For Reference - this is how to send a Request to the on-premise Server using Principal Propagation.

In my case 

      const { retrieveJwt } = require("@sap-cloud-sdk/core");
      const cds = require("@sap/cds");
      const { executeHttpRequest } = require('@sap-cloud-sdk/http-client');
 
      const urlWithParams = "/SomeEntitySet('" + somekey + "')?myurlparams=whatever";
      let reqHeaders = { "Content-Type": "application/json" }    

      const jwt_token = retrieveJwt(req);

      const result = await executeHttpRequest({
            destinationName: cds.requires.onpremisesystem.credentials.destination,
            jwt: jwt_token
        },{
            method: 'GET',
            url: cds.requires.onpremisesystem.credentials.path + urlWithParams,
            headers: reqHeaders
        });

This also gives you the full control of the response, so that you can read the headers for example. Results will be in payload

let the_header = result.headers["some-response-header"];
let odata_answer = result.data.d;

entry.title: SAP Enterprise Support Academy Newsletter September 2025
entry.content:
Dear customers,
Find here an overview of the SAP Enterprise Support Academy monthly newsletter on latest news, training courses, upcoming sessions, and further educational offerings.
The SAP Enterprise Support Academy provides expert guidance and high impact knowledge transfer services that enable you to innovate and be successful with your SAP solutions.

Subscribe to regularly receive latest news and stay informed about the wide range of educational offerings provided by the SAP Enterprise Support Academy that help you to build the digital skills tailored to your needs.

Preview available live sessions on SAP Support Portal, tailored per region:
APJ | EMEA | Latin America | North America*

Unlock the power of SAP Early Watch Alert

Join our interactive e-learning on SAP EarlyWatch Alert, the cloud-based diagnostic tool delivering weekly insights to enhance system health, performance, & security. Master key metrics, proactive recommendations, & navigation. Get started whenever your time allows.

Full details

Rolling out SAP Ariba Category Management?

Whether you are deploying SAP Ariba Category Management alone or with other SAP Ariba or SAP Business Network solutions, we have you covered. Help your business make the most of SAP Ariba Category Management by requesting a deployment readiness CQC. Ready to request remote services?

Check out our blog

The future of logistics with SAP S/4HANA

Join our Expert-Guided Implementation workshop and unleash the power of logistics in SAP S/4HANA. Discover a common view of all logistics solutions and data, get real-time analytics and easy consumable reporting. Transform your logistics processes and drive digital success.

Register for September 8-11

SAP Analytics Cloud BI Core Skills

In September we host an Expert-Guided Implementation session about model and story development in SAP Analytics Cloud. You will be introduced to key topics of connectivity, security configuration, monitoring, and augmented analytics. Learn to develop and customize stories, manage lifecycles, and stay ahead with new features like just ask and Generative AI.

Register here

Explore the parallel line functionality in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Discover the parallel line functionality‚Äîyour key to separating configuration activities post-go-live. Join us to learn about three-system landscapes, lifecycle management, and how to leverage parallel lines for seamless data migration, testing, and training.

 Access here

New sessions added: SAP BW modernization with SAP Business Data Cloud

We have new virtual classrooms for SAP Business Warehouse modernization with SAP Business Data Cloud now open for registration. Sessions are scheduled for EMEA and North America regions.

Full details in the blog

Watch the replays of our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 Early Release Series

From July 21-25, we hosted 21 expert-led live sessions to showcase the highlights of the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release. Missed the live sessions? Watch the replays on demand.

More details

SAP Cloud Identity Services (IAS/IPS): Open Office Hours for SAP Intelligent Spend and Business Network (Ariba and Fieldglass)

Every two weeks, we host open office hours on Wednesdays to answer questions about migrating to SAP Cloud Identity Services (AIS/IPS). Registration is required, and sessions won‚Äôt be recorded. Our goal is to foster and support the adoption of SAP Cloud Identity Services as the go-forward approach, impacting the usage of Corporate IDP and basic authentication.
 
Save September 9 for the next session and register today

Updates from the last SAP Security Patch Day

Familiarize yourself with the new security patches and their implementation challenges and gain latest insights from the last SAP Security Patch Day.  Marc your calendar for September 18 and get tips & tricks related to the last available security notes.
 
Browse through the session materials or register directly

WalkMe onboarding: First experiences last

The WalkMe customer onboarding team offers a seamless and engaging onboarding experience, empowering WalkMe customers to quickly adopt the solution by providing early guidance, enablement, and resources to create a clear and accelerated path to first value realization.
 
Portal page

entry.title: Re: Why do many power users still prefer SAP GUI over Fio...
entry.content:
Hello Kai,

I have seen different situations:

  1. Companies moving to the public cloud -> no choice, Fiori must be used
  2. Companies moving to S/4HANA from a non-SAP ERP system -> Fiori will be used, because it is web based (and in my opinion easier to learn)
  3. Companies moving to S/4HANA from SAP ECC -> a lot of users want to use the GUI, because they now how that works. But there are also always people who want to explore new possibilities.

A lot of companies are already using other cloud applications, so for an employee it makes sense if he/she can open all applications via a webbrowser (in stead of separate programs).

Best Regards,
Henk Hoogerbrug

entry.title: Re: SAP EWM process codes and its language
entry.content:
Hi @GOWRISANKAR_EWM 

Thank you for your question.

To support multilingual process code descriptions in SAP EWM, you must design the solution to store and retrieve descriptions in a language-dependent way rather than writing plain text directly to your main table. To achieve this SAP recommends you follow these steps.

First is to use the Language dependent Text Table Design by creating a separate text table that includes fields for process code, language and description. Whenever a user enters or maintains a process code description, also provide options in other languages for the same code.

Second is to apply the retrieval Logic and thereby making sure that when displaying data, use the user‚Äôs logon language to look up the process code description in the correct language from your text table. If a translation is not available, ensure to use a fallback language which is typically English.

Finally, it is important to follow best Practices that ensures the standard for storing multilingual descriptions. See examples for language-dependent descriptions and supplementation in SAP tables and custom development. Ensure to handle text maintenance centrally in customizing or provide your end-user maintenance options in your program.

SAP‚Äôs guidance on descriptive text tables and language handling

To summarise, it is necessary to redesign your process code description handling to use a separately linked language-dependent table so your client and users see process code descriptions in the desired logon language. This ensures you stick with SAP‚Äôs core data and translation strategy and enables easy multi-language support.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP BTP Trial : Select Transport Request "No change r...
entry.content:
Hello WAIL_ELABOUDI,

Please refer to What's New for SAP BTP ABAP environment: As of release 2508, for sub packages created in software component ZLOCAL, workbench requests are no longer required.

The BTP ABAP trial instances are shared, you could use a different suffix for example if you are folllowing along a tutorial.
Sometimes this is incorporated into the tutorials as a "group number".

To avoid name clashes during development you could create all ABAP objects in a reserved customer namespace in a licensed system.

Regards,
Peter

entry.title: Re: Is BRF+ integrated with SAP Flexible Workflow for dyn...
entry.content:
Hello @MustafaBensan 

There is no standard BRF and plug-in for agent determination in Flexible Workflow for SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. 

However, there are delivery options available, such as responsibility management. This involves maintaining approvers through Manage Teams and Responsibilities and determining agents using BAdI for Procurement with the MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS_V2 call BRF+ from within this BAdI, if you require BRF+ rules. SAP Help Portal-Flexible Workflow

You can also refer to the SAP authoritative references below

Responsibility Management ‚Äì SAP Help: determine agents with teams and responsibility rules. SAP Help Portal-Responsibility Management

BAdI MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS_V2 ‚Äì API Hub: dynamic agent determination (you can call BRF and here). api.sap.com-Public edition Business Add-InsParent Package

KBA 2646400: sample and details for MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS_V2. SAP Support Portal-2646400 - BADI - Workflow Agent determination MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS_V2

Recommendation: Use Responsibility Management for configuration-only cases. If you need rule logic, implement MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS_V2 and invoke BRF+ from that BAdI.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Advanced Intercompany process, the automatically gene...
entry.content:
Hi @ElifTklc 

Thank you for your question.

Based on the questions and the scenarios described, there are some insights to note.

  1. In regard to Intercompany Sales Order not been created automatically, yes, the system should automatically create the Intercompany Sales Order in the supplying company code when the Advanced Intercompany Sales Order is saved in the selling company code. If this is not happening and nothing appears in your Monitor Value Chain app, then you should check some master data issues because they are the most common reasons.
  • First ensure scope item 4AN Advanced Intercompany Sales is active. If only BD9 Intercompany Sales (which is the classic process) is active, the desired automation will not run as it should.
  • Second, check that the intercompany customer supplier relationship is fully maintained. Supplying plant should be assigned to the correct company code, customer or vendor relationship must also be in place.
  • If the order is technically created but blocked, you should see error messages in Monitor Value Chain, an example would be ‚Äúpartner determination issues‚Äù., ‚Äúmissing pricing‚Äù., ‚Äúcustomer assignment problems‚Äù.
  • If after you have validated all of these and the replication still fails, I would advisable you to raise an SAP incident under component SD-VO-IC.
  1. For the Use of Transit Plant scenario, it is important to note that for the transit step in Advanced Intercompany Sales, there are two approaches.
  • First is the Separate Transit Plant which also represents SAP recommended best practice. This approach clearly separates goods in transit from physical plant stock, provides better reporting and process transparency and it also matches SAP‚Äôs best practice scope configuration.
  • Second is the possibility to use an existing plant of the selling company. It is possible, but you lose visibility of goods in transit. It is not recommended for Advanced Intercompany Sales because it complicates monitoring and stock reporting.

See KBA 3650532 for further details.

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: What is SAP BTE 1120 and how is it used?
entry.content:
In SAP ERP and S/4HANA systems, different extension options are offered to make business processes flexible according to customer needs. One of these extension tools is the Business Transaction Events (BTE) structure.

BTE 1120 allows user-defined changes on the document header and items during FI document posting. With this structure, some fields of the document can be updated, changed, or replaced with a fixed value automatically depending on conditions.

BTE 1120 makes it possible to change some fields in BKPF (document header) and BSEG (document items) tables before the document is posted. SAP provides the example function module SAMPLE_INTERFACE_00001120 as a basis for this development.

With this structure, many scenarios can be done, for example:
üìå Assigning a fixed text to the document header reference text field (BKPF_SUBST-BKTXT)
üìå Updating the value date of a document item (BSEG_SUBST-VALUT) depending on a condition
üìå Changing the line item text (BSEG_SUBST-SGTXT) for the customer
üìå Assigning a payment block key (BSEG_SUBST-ZLSPR) to a document item
üìå Changing fields like cost center or activity type according to business rules

Thanks to this exit, when customer documents are posted (for example FB70, F-28, F-32 etc.), you can change values, assign new ones, or manipulate indirect data line by line.

During document posting, the fields XBLNR1 and/or BKTXT in the document header can be replaced with a new field or changed with a fixed value. This allows you to make changes at the time of posting.

During document posting, the fields ZLSPR and/or VALUT in the document item can be replaced with a new field or changed with a fixed value. This makes it possible to modify them at the time of posting.

Application on a Live Scenario:
The user asked us the following:
In personnel expense postings, in the automatically created FI documents, the item text from the personnel line should also appear in all other lines. Also, when posting, the personnel customer code should be added at the beginning of this text. This process should not be done manually, it should work automatically.

This requirement can be done by writing code with BTE 1120. Below, I will explain how to do this.

  DATA: lv_sgtxt   TYPE bseg-sgtxt,
        lv_lƒ±fnr   TYPE bseg-lƒ±fnr,
        lv_found   TYPE abap_bool,
        ls_bseg    TYPE bseg,
        ls_bsegsub TYPE bseg_subst.
  DATA lv_tabix TYPE sy-tabix.

    READ TABLE t_bkpf INTO DATA(ls_bkpf) INDEX 1.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0 OR ls_bkpf-blart <> 'PG'.
    RETURN. " PG deƒüilse √ßƒ±k
  ENDIF.

  LOOP AT t_bseg INTO ls_bseg.
    IF ls_bseg-umskz = '1' AND ls_bseg-sgtxt IS NOT INITIAL.
      lv_sgtxt = ls_bseg-sgtxt.
      lv_lƒ±fnr = ls_bseg-lƒ±fnr.
      lv_found = abap_true.
      EXIT.
    ENDIF.
  ENDLOOP.
  
  IF lv_found = abap_true.
    LOOP AT t_bseg INTO ls_bseg.
      lv_tabix = sy-tabix.

      READ TABLE t_bsegsub INTO ls_bsegsub INDEX lv_tabix.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        CONCATENATE lv_lƒ±fnr lv_sgtxt INTO ls_bsegsub-sgtxt SEPARATED BY space.
        MODIFY t_bsegsub FROM ls_bsegsub INDEX lv_tabix.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDIF.

After the 1120 development was completed, a unit test was done with the transaction code F-02 by entering a document. Before the posting was finished, the explanations entered in the text field were as follows.

Revision of the text field according to the customer‚Äôs request after posting.

In conclusion, BTE 1120 is a strong SAP enhancement point that allows field-level changes during the document creation process. It is especially used when field values in automatically created FI documents need to be replaced according to non-standard rules. Its ability to provide direct solutions for real-life requirements and remove manual intervention makes 1120 a frequently used method in SAP projects.

I hope my writing will be helpful to you.

Best Regards,

Abdullah Kaba

entry.title: Re: What is SAP BTE 1120 and how is it used?
entry.content:
Did you try to post a blog (answer: this is a question)

  • If not already done, start Tour the SAP Community tutorial

entry.title: Is there any reason to purchase SAP BTP when using SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?
entry.content:
Hello,
I have some questions about the Developer Extensibility in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition).

  1.  I would like to create a RAP application by connecting to SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition) via ADT.
        Is it possible to create custom tables starting with prefix Z_?

       According to the following tutorial, it seems possible, but I have not been able to find an official reference:
       > https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/abap-s4hanacloud-procurement-purchasereq-shop..html

   2. If creating custom tables is possible, wouldn‚Äôt using the ABAP Environment service instance on SAP BTP (Business Technology Platform) for side-by-side extensibility be considered an overdose?
      In other words, if a customer is already adopting SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition), is there a real necessity to also introduce SAP BTP (Business Technology Platform)?

I would greatly appreciate any clarification or reference documentation you could share.
Thank you very much in advance for your support and guidance.

Best regards,

entry.title: Re: Analysing ABAP performance by Call Stack
entry.content: Can we do the same call stack analysis in eclipse?

entry.title: Re: SAP EWM process codes and its language
entry.content:
Hello @GOWRISANKAR_EWM 

Process code descriptions are language dependent. They are stored in the /SCDL/TEXCODET table. You can translate the descriptions in the process codes configuration, SPRO: SCM Extended Warehouse Management -> Extended Warehouse Management -> Cross-Process Settings -> Delivery - Warehouse Request -> Process Codes -> Define Process Codes

I guess either your Z-process code descriptions are wrong or your custom EWM monitor node reads the descriptions incorrectly.

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: Read Data from excel file using Rest API ABAP
entry.content: @benedict-torres For information, your code has a syntax error, because CL_RSDA_CSV_CONVERTER is of type "create private" so you can't use NEW (nor CREATE OBJECT). You may instantiate the class only by calling the method CL_RSDA_CSV_CONVERTER=>CREATE.

entry.title: Re: Error in print preview
entry.content: You need to check with the ABAP person , or just scroll down the dump page and check there must a arrow on left which will show you the line of code where the issue raised.

entry.title: How to integrate SAP Cloud ALM with SAP ECP
entry.content:
Hello,
We are trying to integrate SAP ECP with SAP Cloud ALM in order to enable Health Monitoring.

We are following the official setup guide here:

 

But face error Error: OAuth access_token not found from Destination :######## (HTTP/1.1 401 Unauthorized)


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to integrate SAP Cloud ALM with SAP ECP
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

 

Thanks for contacting SAP.

For the "OAuth access_token not found from Destination " error, it is supposed that you are missing code corrections for ST-PI version, please kindly refer to KBA 3316324 Error "OAuth access_token not found from Destination :######## (HTTP/1.1 401 Unauthorized)" in on-premise managed systems registered to SAP Cloud ALM

for the steps in detail.

And for  ST-A/PI version > 01U_731, there is no note to be implemented just  keep them up-to-date.  

If you upgrade the version to ST-A/PI version 01W, refer to SAP Notes listed here for more details.

 

Please kindly let me know when issue still and kindly provide access to the managed system.

 

Thanks and Regards,

Sunny

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Exporting reports to Excel
entry.content: Check notes such as 2695161 - Export to Excel option not available from FIORI recipe relevant apps that siggest  to request such functionality as a product improvement (Note 11 - Would you like to shape & influence future releases of SAP Products?, Site SAP Customer Influence site)

entry.title: Re: Streamlining Local App Previews: Virtual Endpoints for Seamless Development
entry.content:
@MMonis first of all sorry for the late reply üôè

the preview-middleware (or fiori-tools-preview depending on what package you prefer) is not depending on SAP Fiori elements. So as long as you want to run your app locally using the flp sandbox, freestyle apps are welcome.

As all of this is open source you can check e.g. the template for UI5 1.x yourself in case you are interested.

entry.title: Re: Automatic creating a Interaction record in the WebClient
entry.content: If i am not providing business Transaction profile then the interaction record work centre is indicating the error : Transaction cancelled".

entry.title: Re: Streamlining Local App Previews: Virtual Endpoints for Seamless Development
entry.content:
@soujanya_vanteru_ sorry for the late reply üôè

the performance for the local preview of course always depends on your hardware. Reading the static html file from disk versus dynamically creating the template based html file on-the-fly at runtime... I did not really see a change in performance to be honest. But the goal of this middleware is rather to get rid of those files that are part of (and need to be maintained in) each and every app repository.

Did you experience any performance improvements / degradation?

If you encounter any performance issues you can reach out to us at https://github.com/SAP/open-ux-tools/issues

entry.title: In SAP ECC, when manually converting a PR in a PO, PR Not Referenced When Creating PO from MD04
entry.content:
I‚Äôm experiencing an issue when converting PR to PO via MD04: the system does not reference the PR, no message appears, and the PO opens blank. It does not happen with my colleagues.

  • Same PR works fine for other users.

  • PR is released, no blocks or deletion flag.

  • Issue seems specific to my user.

Can anyone help me?
